name: Crawfish Bisque
author: Randy Brown
summary: This rich, creamy soup will knock you off your feet! Great as part of a large meal, but meaty enough to use as a full meal.
ingredients: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion until golden, about 8 minutes
Stir in the flour until smooth, and cook and stir the mixture until it turns a pale golden color, about 5 minutes
Whisk in the chicken broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps, then mix in the half-and-half, salt, crawfish tails, Worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper
Reduce heat to medium-low, and continue whisking as soup comes to a simmer
Allow the bisque to simmer for about 5 minutes, until slightly thickened
